page.title: 07Role of farmer's wife.
page.content: This is no sinecure.His wife may take over all the farmer's paper- work as well as the jobs that are hers by tradition:looking after the poultry,for instance.Many a farm announces(enticingly these days)that "free-range eggs"are for sale.Geese and turkeys are bought as chicks (one source is Peterborough) and fattened for Christmas.Honey and clotted cream are also sold at the farm door. At busy times on the farm she will lend a hand.I have seen one humping food out to sheep in the snow,for instance.To be able to drive is imperative,for the children must be chauffeured to school,extra lessons, meetings,dentist,etc. And she will drive anything.Three-thirty may well see Mum at the school-gate,not in a car,but in the tractor!
